page.title: 02Landscape around Rogate
page.content: Much of the surrounding terrain is undulating land used for arable farming for such crops as wheat, oats and barley. Trees, however cover a large portion of the land.A mixture of evergreens and deciduous they provide much of the local small industry hidden away in the woods where it is cut, dried and stored. Whole patches are cut for coppicing to be used in fencing. One man we heard of spent his entire day working alone just coppicing his patch quite content among the stumps without anyone to talk to. The woods are also used for horse training. There are at least two cleared areas set out as dressage rings and much evidence of horse exercise on the footpaths. A rich middle eastern gentleman owns one such school.
